I posted MultipleClassTestRunner.java to the files section.  I hope 
people find it useful.  It's a small change to allow the 
textui.TestRunner to run multiple classes given on the command line.

This turns out to be useful in our build environment which relies on 
gmake.  JUnit testfiles are specifed in the Makefiles.  They are built 
and the class names saved in a variable which is then fed to 
MultipleClassTestRunner.  

This has two main benefits:
a) it consolidates all the results in one report
b) test suite classes don't have to be maintained

The drawback is that it conflicts with another usage scenario that's 
been mentioned.  Some people would like to be able to specify the 
class and a single test method to run.  Hopefully, this functionality 
can be combined with what's presented here and rolled into the 
existing textui runner.

cheers,
Kevin
